title: Graduate Research Assistant — Software/AI Engineer
org: California State University, San Bernardino (Office of Institutional Research)
bullets: Build internal tools and REST APIs for survey reporting/analysis; translate stakeholder requirements into maintainable services and data pipelines aligned with reporting workflows.
Partner with directors, analysts, and IT to scope features, validate data sources, iterate on real usage, and document business rules + edge cases for long-term maintainability.

AI Integrated Survey Assistant (LLM + RAG): built a FastAPI backend that accepts natural-language queries, retrieves relevant survey content, and returns grounded results with survey IDs/links for verification.
Implemented ingestion + indexing workflows: clean/normalize survey documents, chunk content, generate embeddings, and store vectors in FAISS for fast semantic retrieval.

Improved relevance and usability with ranking/filter rules, lightweight caching for repeat queries, and iterative prompt/result formatting based on staff feedback; added basic usage analytics to guide tuning.

AIMS Scheduling: co-designed a normalized scheduling data model (tables/keys/constraints) and defined API views for browsing schedules by instructor/course/room and surfacing conflicts + workload issues.

title: Software Engineer Trainee
bullets: Delivered backend features and bug fixes in a Python/Java microservices codebase via Jira tickets, code reviews, and branch-based workflows.
Implemented REST endpoint enhancements and background workers with request validation and consistent error handling to reduce client-facing failures.
Improved observability with structured logging and request-level diagnostics; added basic unit tests to catch regressions during QA and deployments.
Wrapped model inference behind Python services and standardized JSON inputs/outputs with metrics/logs for monitoring and troubleshooting.
Wrote clear README/ticket notes so changes were easy to understand, test, and maintain.

title: Data Scientist
bullets: Prepared datasets from SQL/CSV sources by cleaning, joining, and standardizing data; handled missing values/outliers and engineered features for modeling tasks.
Trained and compared baseline ML models (classification/regression) using metric-driven evaluation and error analysis; documented trade-offs and recommended next steps.
Built repeatable preprocessing and training workflows in Python (scripts/notebooks) to keep experiments reproducible and iteration fast across datasets and model variants.
Communicated results with concise summaries (metrics + practical implications) to support stakeholder decisions and engineering integration.
